title: Jorginho's agent 'refuses to rule out a return to Serie A'
text:
Jorginho's agent has suggested that the Italian going back to Serie A in the future could be on the cards, according to Radio Sportiva.

'In football everything is possible, the desire to return [to Italy] is always there,' said Joao Santos.

Jorginho arrived at Chelsea from Napoli for around £57million, but failed to adapt to life in the Premier League in his first season at the club.

Jorginho's agent has refused to rule out a move back to Serie A for the Italian Chelsea player

Jorginho was on target for his national side on Saturday, scoring a penalty against Greece

With new manager Frank Lampard taking over from Maurizio Sarri, Jorginho's form has improved, however he could still be moving away sooner rather than later.

'With the experience gained in the Premier could make a great contribution to Serie A,' Santos continued. 'He could play in the two or three times fighting for the Scudetto.'

Jorginho scored in Italy's win over Greece in their Euro 2020 qualifier on Saturday, converting his 15th penalty out of 16 in his career for club and country.

'It's been a positive year for him, he is doing well in the national team. He always scores penalties... I think Jorginho will do very well in the next European Championships, and why not also in the next World Cup?

'On the other hand, there are not so many opportunities in the national team and we always have to be ready for every game.'

Jorginho will be back in action for Chelsea against Newcastle in the Premier League on October 19 at Stamford Bridge.
